result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Adam C. Hughes was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Adam C. Hughes was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Adam C. Hughes was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Final Reminder Notice with request to pay in full or set up payment plan has been sent to the Defendant's address in the file as of this date. 
Failure to pay or set up payment plan--warrant to be issued.
Ordered vacated per TTF/defendant incarcerated in prison projected release date in October 2017.  Extension granted until October for payment plan to be established.
Warrant delivered to dispatch by Court Officer
Receivables List 1
SPD financial sheet

Defendant Adam C. Hughes in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 16CF200, 14CF223

16CF200 Motion Hearing: 
Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court. 
Atty McFarland concurs. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court will hold in abayance any decision on the motion in this matter, this case is tracking with 16CF322.

14CF223 Blessinger Hearing Held: 
This a Blessinger Hearing for a Committment Warrant that was issued for failure to pay fines, fees, or costs that were previously ordered by the Court.  

Court questions the Defendant as to his/her reasons for failing to pay and his/her financial status.
Defendant makes statements to the Court.   Defendant is employed by EconoLodge.  
Atty McFarland makes statements as to the status of the defendant's incarceration. 
Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court re: probation sentence. 
Court questions the defendant further. 
Atty McFarland makes statements to the Court re: ATR. 
Court informs the Defendant that serving time in jail will not reduce or eliminate the fine.

BY THE COURT:  
Court vacates the committment order and orders the defendant to pay $75 per month commencing 12/10/16 and $75 per month by the 10th each month thereafter.
Payment plan set
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Adam C. Hughes in court with attorney Sean Drury.  Defendant, Adam C Hughes, in CUSTODY.  Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:18 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Atty Drury states this is before the Court on a bond modification.
Court requests a brief moment to review the bond and motion of Atty Drury.
Atty Drury makes statements regarding the bond modification from $5,000 cash bond to $500 cash bond.
Atty Drury would like a couple of moments to discuss a resolution to this case with Atty Cousins.
10:24 a.m.  Court is in a brief recess.
10:49 a.m.  Court is back in session.
***Case will be going to a Plea/Sentencing.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No Contest
Count 2 - Dismissed
Count 3 - No Contest
Count 4 - DRI
Count 5 - DRI
Count 6 - No Contest 
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Counts 1, 3 & 6 and Count 2 is dismissed and Count 4 & 5 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Parties are ready to proceed to sentencing.
State argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Court asks the Defendant if he/she wants to make any statements.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
17 days jail, credit for 40 days served - confinement portion satisfied
Pay fine of $450 plus costs for a total of $1,505.00
Pay blood draw of $26.45
14 month IID on any vehicles he may drive or has titled in his name
14 months DL Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations. 
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

Count 3:
Pay fine + costs
zero days suspension
zero day jail

Count 6:
40 days jail concurrent to Count 1
Pay costs
40 days  jail credit
and Notice of Motion

Pre-trial conference on August 4, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant received copy of information.

NOT GUILTY Pleas entered.

Defendant Adam C. Hughes in court with attorney Sean Drury. Defendant Adam C. Hughes in custody. Veronica Isherwood with Intern Taylor Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

BY THE COURT:
